item.title: フロリダ州知事ロン・デサンティスのTwitter Spacesでの大統領選発表では、クラッシュ、フィードバックの不具合、音声の失敗が発生（Kevin Breuninger/CNBC)
item.description:
Kevin Breuninger / CNBC:
Florida Governor Ron DeSantis' presidential campaign announcement on Twitter Spaces suffers crashes, feedback glitches, and audio failures  —  - Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis' presidential campaign announcement plans evening were derailed by massive technical glitches on Twitter that prevented him from declaring his candidacy.

item.title: The MessengerとCNNはどちらもダウン・ザ・ミドルなニュースを約束し、「偏ったメディア」に対する解毒剤として売り込もうとしているが、人々がそれを望んでいる証拠はほとんどない（Peter Kafka/Vox）。
item.description:
Peter Kafka / Vox:
Both The Messenger and CNN promise down-the-middle news and try to sell themselves as antidotes to “biased media”, but there's little evidence people want that  —  CNN and the Messenger both say they're chasing the middle.  Uh-oh.  —  Item 1: Last week, the Messenger …

item.title: インサイダー・ユニオンによると、組合員の94％が、賃金、レイオフ、ヘルスケアなどをめぐる最初の契約を交渉する間、ストライキを承認する投票をしたという。（The NewsGuild of New York）
item.description:
The NewsGuild of New York:
The Insider Union says 94% of its members voted to authorize a strike while the union negotiates its first contract over wages, layoffs, health care, and more  —  Vote follows management illegally changing workers' health care and a proposal in April to lay off 20% of bargaining unit

item.title: フォーブスのある寄稿者は、2つの記事原稿を「承認と変更のために最初に」情報源に送った。他の作家は、ジャーナリズムに損害を与える行為として批判している（Andrew Fedorov/The Fine Print）。
item.description:
Andrew Fedorov / The Fine Print:
A Forbes contributor sent two story drafts to his source “first for approval and changes”; other writers are criticizing the practice as damaging to journalism  —  A publicist's email snafu reveals the lax editorial standards — allowing sources to review copy before publication …

item.title: 長編小説を書くための生成AIツール、SudowriteのStory Engineをハンズオン！予想以上によく動くが、まだ大きな限界がある（Adi Robertson/The Verge）
item.description:
Adi Robertson / The Verge:
Hands-on with Sudowrite's Story Engine, a generative AI tool for writing long-form fiction novels that works better than expected but still has big limitations  —  Thoughts are swarming my mind like a nest of cyber-rats.  —  Last week, generative fiction tool Sudowrite launched a system for writing whole novels.

item.title: 反発を受けたMaxは、監督と脚本家を「クリエイター」にまとめていた技術的な「見落とし」を理由に、映画のクレジット表記を分割して変更する予定です（Todd Spangler/Variety）。
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
After backlash, Max will change back film credit listings to break out directors and writers, blaming a technical “oversight” for grouping them under “creators”  —  Now the company says it is changing the listings back to how they were presented on HBO Max, blaming the issue on a technical “oversight.”

item.title: リンダ・ヤッカリーノの主な課題は、イーロン・マスクを満足させながらTwitterの広告主との関係を改善することで、情報筋によると、彼女は自分の知名度を上げたいと考えているようだ（Sarah Frier/Bloomberg)
item.description:
Sarah Frier / Bloomberg:
Linda Yaccarino's main challenge will be improving Twitter's advertiser relationships while keeping Elon Musk happy; sources say she wants to raise her profile  —  Elon Musk joked in December that he'd step down as Twitter's chief executive officer once he found someone “foolish enough” to take his place.

item.title: Semaforは、Sam Bankman-Friedからの$10Mに代わって、Yahoo共同創業者のJerry Yangらから$19Mを調達し、コンセントはこれまでに2023年の収益が$10M+だとしている（Benjamin Mullin/New York Times）
item.description:
Benjamin Mullin / New York Times:
Semafor raised $19M from Yahoo co-founder Jerry Yang and others, replacing the $10M from Sam Bankman-Fried, and says the outlet has $10M+ in 2023 revenue so far  —  The media start-up's new backers include Henry Kravis, a founder of the private-equity giant KKR, and Jerry Yang, a Yahoo founder.

item.title: BuzzFeed、ライフスタイルコマースブランド「Goodful」のVerishop搭載オンラインストアをデビュー、ライセンス品とキュレーション品を組み合わせた初のストア（Sara Fischer/Axios）
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
BuzzFeed debuts a Verishop-powered online store for its lifestyle commerce brand Goodful, its first store combining licensed and curated goods  —  BuzzFeed on Tuesday will debut a new online retail storefront for Goodful, a lifestyle commerce brand it launched in 2016 initially as a joint venture with snack company Mondelez.

item.title: ベラルーシ、飛行機を傍受して逮捕され8年の刑を受けたジャーナリスト、ロマン・プロタセビッチを恩赦、かつての盟友は寝返ったと語る（Andrew Higgins/New York Times）
item.description:
Andrew Higgins / New York Times:
Belarus pardons Roman Protasevich, the journalist sentenced to eight years after his arrest on an intercepted flight; former allies say he has turned on them  —  Roman Protasevich became a symbol of the struggle for democracy when Belarus forced down a plane and arrested him.

item.title: WBDのMax（旧HBO Max）では、脚本家や監督などのクリエイターの具体的なクレジットは表示されず、「クリエイター」の下にまとめられている（Lesley Goldberg/The Hollywood Reporter）。
item.description:
Lesley Goldberg / The Hollywood Reporter:
WBD's Max, formerly HBO Max, does not provide specific credits for writers, directors, and other creatives, instead grouping them under “Creators”  —  The former HBO Max no longer provides specific credits for writers, directors and other creatives.

item.title: The American Prospect、Balls and Strikes、Bolts、The Guardian US、Hammer & Hope、Popular Information、States Newsroomは政治ジャーナリズムを再構築している（Perry Bacon Jr/Washington Post）。
item.description:
Perry Bacon Jr / Washington Post:
The American Prospect, Balls and Strikes, Bolts, The Guardian US, Hammer & Hope, Popular Information, and States Newsroom are reimagining political journalism  —  Political journalism is in crisis.  Over the past few months, BuzzFeed News, FiveThirtyEight, Vice and a number of other outlets …

item.title: 200万ドルのジェラルディン・R・ドッジ財団の助成金が地元ジャーナリズムに与えた広大な影響と、地元の人々が実験する余地があったときに協力的なメディアがいかに成長したか（Molly de Aguiar)
item.description:
Molly de Aguiar:
How a $2M Geraldine R. Dodge Foundation grant had a sprawling impact on local journalism and how cooperative media grew when local people had room to experiment  —  Trusting local people, championing their dreams, and giving them the resources to build a different future.  —  By Molly de Aguiar + Josh Stearns

item.title: 2019年に〜50万人だった購読者を2022年12月に30のメール製品で100万人を突破させるニューヨークマガジンのニュースレターへの投資を見てみる（Mark Stenberg/Adweek）
item.description:
Mark Stenberg / Adweek:
A look at New York Magazine's investment in newsletters, growing its subscribers from ~500K in 2019 to pass 1M across its 30 email products in December 2022  —  The publisher has used pop-up, subscriber-only newsletters to boost retention  —  Since retooling its newsletter strategy in 2019 …

item.title: イーロン・マスクがTwitterを買収した意図は、メディアに力を与えると認識していたツールを解体するだけでなく、アプリを右翼の重鎮にすることだった（Philip Bump/Washington Post）。
item.description:
Philip Bump / Washington Post:
Elon Musk's intent in buying Twitter wasn't only to dismantle a tool he perceived as empowering the media but also to turn the app into a right-wing heavyweight  —  It was only a year ago that Elon Musk, then simply the guy who was hoping to buy Twitter, insisted that his politics sat squarely at the center of the national spectrum.
